text: The 1937 Western Reserve Red Cats football team represented Western Reserve University in the American city of Cleveland, Ohio, now known as Case Western Reserve University, during the 1937 college football season. The team was coached by college football hall of fame coach Bill Edwards. Notable players included Frank "Doc" Kelker, Phil Ragazzo, Albie Litwak, Mike Rodak, and Johnny Wilson. The Red Cats went undefeated while at home The loss to Dayton on October 30 ended a 28-game unbeaten streak stretching back to the 1934 season. ==Schedule== ==References== Western Reserve Category:Case Western Reserve Spartans football seasons Western Reserve football
title: 1937 Western Reserve Red Cats football team
